intro: Matelea medusae, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a striking plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white or pale pink flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. Matelea medusae thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths.
